domain

Class PlayerTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • domain.PlayerTest

  • public class PlayerTest
extends java.lang.Object
    This Junit Test Class will have all the test cases for Player class.
    Author:
    Yogesh

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.List<Continent> continentList
      It hold collection of all the continents in game in list.
      private java.util.HashSet<Continent> continentsSet
      It hold collection of all the continents in game in set.
      private Player player
      To hold GameService class instance.
      private java.util.HashSet<Territory> territoriesSet
      It hold collection of all the territory in game in set.
      private java.util.List<Territory> territoryList
      It hold collection of all the territories in game in list.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PlayerTest() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void setUp()
      This method setup require common context before every test is run.
      void testAttackCaseOne()
      This method test Player.attack(Territory, Territory, Player, boolean, int, int, PhaseViewModel) method where attack mode is normal and there is only one army attacking and defending in both territories.
      void testAttackCaseTwo()
      This method test Player.attack(Territory, Territory, Player, boolean, int, int, PhaseViewModel) method where attack mode is All-out.
      void testAttackerHelperCaseOne()
      This method will test the Player.attackerHelper(Territory, Territory, List, List, PhaseViewModel) method where attacker beats defender completely.
      void testAttackerHelperCaseTwo()
      This method will test the Player.attackerHelper(Territory, Territory, List, List, PhaseViewModel) method where attacker beats defender's one army and defender beats attacker's one army.
      void testFortify()
      This test will test the fortification logic which is done by Player.fortify(Territory, Territory, int) method.
      void testRecordDiceRolls()
      This method tests Player.recordDiceRolls(int, boolean) method where armySize and if player for which dice are rolled is attacker or defender will decide how many dices can be rolled.
      void testReinforcement()
      This test will test the reinforcement logic which is done by Player.reinforcement(Territory, int) method.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
